availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Virginia, U.S.A. soldier. Covington, Virginia native. Son of William H. Terrill and Elizabeth Pitzer Terrill. Married to Emily Henry Terrill. Graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York in 1853. Assistant professor of mathematics at the U.S. Military Academy from 1853 to 1854. Served in the U.S. Artillery from 1853 to 1861. Served in the 5th U.S. Regular Artillery Regiment as captain from August 14, 1861 to September 1862. Served in the Union Army as brigadier general of volunteers from September 9, 1862 to October 8, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Appletons’ Cyclopedia of American Biography, Vol. VI (New York: D. Appleton and Company, 1889), p. 65.
Stuart W. Sanders, “William R. Terrill (1834-1862),” in Encyclopedia Virginia, https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/TerrillWilliamR1834-1862#startentry (accessed December 20, 2018).
